result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke A Durnford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luke A Durnford in court.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw in court for Luke A Durnford.  Attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
For reasons set forth in the record, defense counsel requests an adjournment for a resolution date. Court grants request.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Luke A Durnford in court.  Attorney Kaitlin Z. Grasswick in court for Attorney Morgan Risseeuw.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for DPA hearing. Defense is requesting an adjournment for reasons stated on the record. State has no objection. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant Luke A Durnford in court.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw in court for Luke A Durnford.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. Case in DPA posture. Defendant has TAD evaluation scheduled.
Case adjourned.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms unless on duty serving for the National Guard or during any training where a firearm is needed for the National Guard.

Defendant Luke A Durnford in court with attorney Kathleen A Kruse.  Annie Louk, along with student intern Madaline Witte under the student practice rule, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
